CONJUGATES: amaze (v) | amazed (pt) | amazes (3rd sg) | amazingly (adv) | amazement (n)
ETYMOLOGY: Present participle of the verb 'amaze', from Middle English amasian, from Old English āmasian 'to bewilder, confuse', related to mase 'delusion, confusion'. The sense 'astonishingly good' developed from the 18th century.
SINCE: c. 1600 (as a descriptive adjective, though the verb is older)

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Causing great wonder, astonishment, or admiration; extremely impressive or surprising.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 令人惊异的；了不起的；令人赞叹的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The special effects in the movie were absolutely amazing.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这部电影的特效简直令人惊叹。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used informally to mean excellent or highly pleasing.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 极好的；非常棒的；超赞的（常用于口语中表达赞美）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I had an amazing cup of coffee this morning.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 今天早上我喝了一杯超棒的咖啡。
